content.description: Climb the tall crack and top out
content.location: Obvious crack up the center of the face

content.description: Laydown start under the UFO. Mantle over the top and don't dab. Rather burly.
content.location: This is the obvious 3 ft tall flat rock in the back of The Pit.

content.description: Stand start the exceptionally mossy slab with shelf jug footholds. Climb straight up and over the subtle sweeping arete to the lower angled slab with smooth features. Either use the nicely cleaned slopers and a high pocket to reach the lip and topout, or clean your own holds and smears.
content.location: From the main face of The Pit area, walk through the square 'doorway' and look immediately to the right. This line climbs up the tall mossy slab. There is a natural rock table about a pad's width way from this slab, so be sure not to fall onto it if you punt the crux. Red on the topo.

content.description: Stand start below the tall arete on flat foot jugs. Trudge up through moss to a jug below the arete. Use pockets and crimps on the arete and face holds to the left to climb up the arete and topout.
content.location: From the main face of The Pit area, walk through the square 'doorway' and look immediately to the right. This line climbs up the tall mossy slab. There is a natural rock table about a pad's width way from this slab, so be sure not to fall onto it if you punt the crux. Purple on the topo.

content.description: Sit start on the low flat jug on the arete with hidden feet.  Make a tough move to the jug, then dyno to the lip.  Mantle onto the shelf, then either walk left to top-out or downclimb the chimney to the right.
content.location: Located on the right arete of the gently overhanging face.  Next the the rock stairs feature in the chimney
